title: Personal Loans
introduction: Personal loans are unsecured loans provided to individuals for various personal needs without requiring collateral.

content.value: Personal loans offer flexibility and convenience for customers with various financial needs.
Personal loans typically range from ₹50,000 to ₹20 lakhs, depending on the borrower's eligibility and the lender's policies.
Interest rates on personal loans usually range from 10.5% to 24% per annum, depending on the borrower's credit profile, income, and relationship with the bank.
Loan repayment periods typically range from 12 months to 60 months (1-5 years).
Banks charge a processing fee ranging from 1% to 3% of the loan amount, which may be subject to a minimum amount.
Banks assess various factors to determine a customer's eligibility for a personal loan.

items: Age: Typically 21-60 years (should be of working age)
Income: Minimum monthly income requirement (varies by bank)
Employment: Stable employment history (typically minimum 2 years)
Credit Score: Good credit history with CIBIL score above 750 preferred
Existing Obligations: Low debt-to-income ratio (usually below 50%)

content.value: The following documents are typically required for personal loan applications:

items: Identity Proof: PAN Card, Aadhaar Card, Passport, Voter ID
Address Proof: Aadhaar Card, Utility Bills, Passport, Driving License
Income Proof: Salary Slips (3-6 months), Form 16, IT Returns
Bank Statements: Last 3-6 months of primary bank account
Employment Details: Employee ID, Job Appointment Letter

content.value: The personal loan application process typically follows these steps:

items: Application Submission: Online or at branch with required documents
Verification: Document and credit history verification
Approval: Loan approval based on eligibility assessment
Disbursement: Funds transferred to the customer's account
Repayment: EMI payments as per agreed schedule
